Daens (1993)

92
Your Score
Excellent(Tier 10)
Your Rating
500 characters left
Link to Full Review
Links Must Be To Criticker's Full Reviews Forum
Edit Score - Delete Score
Ranked on December 18th, 2009

In the 1890s, Father Adolf Daens goes to Aalst, a textile town where child labor is rife, pay and working conditions are horrible, the poor have no vote, and the Catholic church backs the petite bourgeoisie in oppressing workers. He writes a few columns for the Catholic paper, and soon workers are listening and the powerful are in an uproar... (imdb)

More Film Information and Actions

Genre: Drama

Country: Belgium, France, Netherlands

Directed By: Stijn Coninx

Written By: Louis Paul Boon, François Chevallier

Starring: Jan Decleir, Johan Leysen, Michael Pas, Gérard Desarthe, Antje de Boeck, Jappe Claes

Additional Information & Actions
